ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English 'enquirie', from Old French 'enquerie', from the verb 'enquerir' (to inquire), ultimately from Latin 'inquirere' (to seek into).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) that is used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 询问；查询；打听 (获取信息的请求)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We have received an inquiry about the availability of the new model.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们收到了关于新款型号是否有货的询问。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) that is used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An official investigation to discover facts or truth about something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 调查；查究；审讯 (正式的调查以查明事实或真相)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The government has launched an inquiry into the cause of the accident.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 政府已对事故原因展开调查。

REGISTER: Commonly used in both formal and informal contexts, though the 'investigation' meaning leans more towards formal or official use.
